title: User Registration and Authentication
description: Verify that users can register and authenticate successfully across all user types including registered users, guests, and institutional users with proper security measures.

steps.description: Navigate to the registration page.
Register as a new user with valid credentials.
Verify registration is successful and user receives confirmation.
Attempt login with valid registered user credentials.
Verify login is successful and user is redirected to dashboard.
Attempt guest login.
Verify guest user is authenticated with limited access appropriately.
Attempt institution user login with valid credentials.
Verify institution user login is successful and institution dashboard loads.
Attempt login with invalid credentials.
Verify login is denied with appropriate error messages.
Test session management by refreshing page and verifying session persistence.
Confirm user stays logged in until logout.
Log out from all user types.
Verify session ends and user is redirected to login page.

title: Audio/Video Interview Functionality
description: Verify the complete workflow of audio/video interviews including initiation, real-time streaming, voice activity detection, and completion.

steps.description: Login as a candidate user.
Navigate to the interview scheduling or initiation page.
Select audio/video interview type.
Start the audio/video interview session.
Verify audio and video streams are properly connected and visible.
Verify voice activity detection is active and detects candidate speech.
Perform sample audio/video interactions.
Confirm real-time streaming has no significant latency or dropouts.
End the interview session.
Verify interview session ends gracefully and summary screen is shown.
Try to start an audio/video interview with insufficient user credits.
Verify system blocks the interview start and shows insufficient credits message.

title: DSA and Coding Interview Execution
description: Verify users can perform coding and data structure algorithm interviews with real-time code editor, streaming interaction, and speech recognition integration.

steps.description: Login as candidate.
Navigate to coding/DSA interview interface.
Select a coding challenge question.
Verify coding editor loads with syntax highlighting and correct programming language.
Start code interview session with real-time streaming enabled.
Write and run code in the editor.
Verify code execution outputs and errors are correctly displayed.
Use voice commands if supported to input or control the code editor.
Verify speech recognition captures commands accurately and modifies code accordingly.
Submit the coding interview.
Verify submission is successful and user is notified.
Attempt to submit without writing code.
Verify system shows a warning or prevents empty submission.

title: AI-Generated Interview Feedback and Performance Analysis
description: Validate that AI feedback and detailed interview analysis are generated accurately and displayed with correct UI components after interview submission.

steps.description: Complete an interview (audio/video or coding).
Submit responses and wait for AI analysis.
Verify AI feedback is received and displayed within expected timeframe.
Check that detailed insights are rendered using correct UI components for the interview type.
Confirm that performance metrics align with submitted responses.
Navigate through different result views including overview, DSA-specific, and aptitude results.
Verify all data visualizations and feedback UI components behave correctly and responsively.
Attempt to access interview results of another user without permission.
Validate access is denied with an appropriate error message.

title: Institution Course, Batch, and Interview Scheduling Management
description: Verify institution users can manage courses, create batches, and schedule interviews accurately with no data inconsistencies.

steps.description: Login as an institution user.
Navigate to course management section.
Create, edit, and delete courses.
Verify course data updates correctly and is reflected immediately in UI.
Create batches and assign users to batches.
Confirm batch creation is successful and users are assigned properly.
Schedule interviews for batches with different interview types.
Verify schedules are saved without conflicts or data loss.
Attempt to schedule overlapping interviews.
Confirm system warns about schedule conflicts and prevents invalid scheduling.

title: User Dashboard and Admin Panel Accessibility and Controls
description: Ensure correct dashboard and control panels load for users, institution admins, and super-admins, with access restrictions enforced securely.

steps.description: Login as a standard candidate user.
Verify candidate dashboard loads with relevant information and controls.
Login as institutional admin user.
Verify admin dashboard loads with institution management and user controls.
Login as super-admin user.
Verify super-admin dashboard loads with platform-wide controls and insights.
Attempt to access admin or super-admin pages as unauthorized user.
Verify access is denied and user is redirected or shown error.
Perform administrative actions such as user management, course modification, and interview oversight.
Ensure changes execute correctly and reflect immediately without errors.

title: Credit Management and Enforcement
description: Verify that user credits are correctly displayed, properly deducted upon interview initiation and maintenance, and that interview start is blocked when credits are insufficient.

steps.description: Login as any user with available credits.
Check credit balance display on dashboard or credit display component.
Verify displayed credits match backend data and update in real-time on usage.
Initiate an interview requiring credit deduction.
Verify credits are deducted appropriately and immediately.
Attempt to initiate an interview with zero or insufficient credits.
Verify system blocks the process and shows an insufficient credits warning.
Add credits via administrative means or credit purchasing.
Validate credit balance updates correctly and usage is reflected post interview.

title: UI Components Responsiveness and Cross-Browser Compatibility
description: Verify that all reusable UI components such as navigation bars, footers, dashboards, and feedback components respond correctly on different devices and browsers.

steps.description: Access the application on desktop browsers: Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge.
Verify layout integrity, component visibility, and interactive elements function as expected.
Access the application on mobile devices with various screen sizes.
Confirm UI adjusts appropriately with no overlaps, components scale properly, and usability is maintained.
Test interactive components such as dropdowns, modals, and navigation bars for responsiveness.
Ensure all UI components behave correctly on both touch and mouse pointer interactions.

title: Error Handling on Network Failures and API Errors
description: Ensure the system gracefully handles network failures, API errors, and unexpected server responses with user-friendly error messages and recovery options.

steps.description: Simulate network failure during login.
Verify user is shown an appropriate connectivity error message.
Simulate server error during interview submission.
Confirm system prevents data loss, retries if applicable, or informs user to retry submission.
Force API returning invalid data for interview results.
Verify UI handles data gracefully without crashing and shows fallback message.
Simulate credit check API failure while starting interview.
Confirm system blocks interview initiation with proper error notification.
